page.title: 01Desford, Newbold Verdon Area
page.content: The area is a rural belt of farmland, with a strong coal mining history. It encompasses the two large villages of Desford and Newbold Verdon, and the hamlets of Merrylees, and Newbold Heath. Both Desford and Newbold are large dormitory villages with much of the workforce being employed in the nearby connurbations of Hinckley and Leicester. The local mines are now closed, but many miners are still employed at Bagworth. Both villages are a mixture of old houses, a large council and large newer private housing estates. Dairy farming tends to dominate the agricultural scene, although a variety of crops are grown on the arable land.
